ygData.subject: RE: [EQ-Monks] Lvl 31 Equipment Help
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Bah!  I put all my points into Agil and did all my gear based on agil because it was the theory of the week.  Massive Disadvantage?  Now STR is the theory
ygData.messageBody:
RE: [EQ-Monks] Lvl 31 Equipment Help

>One thing I have noticed about EQ melee classes is that none of them are
>dependant on anything besides strength, and as a monk, you want str at your
>level because odds are you are not the tank. I made the mistake of putting
>all my points into agility, and buying all agi stuff, i am level 20, but am
>probably stopping the character because he has a massive disadvantage to
>everyone else.


Bah!  I put all my points into Agil and did all my gear based on agil because it was the theory of the week.  Massive Disadvantage?  Now STR is the theory of the week.  My monk is now level 40 and I don't see any big differences between me and the other monks who went all str.  Sure now I'm putting some STR gear on, but leaning heavily towards AC and MR.

Besides, at level 20 you've *just* gotten your STR attack bonus - how would you even notice?   What "Massive Disadvantage" could you have possibly uncovered?  Face it, As much as Verant would like us to believe stats are worthwhile, I think in their addiction to "Balancing" the classes they don't really mean squat.

Just play your character and have fun.
